concepts.concept_name: Asexual reproduction: binary fission, sporulation, budding, fragmentation, vegetative propagation
Sexual reproduction: events and significance; pre-fertilisation, fertilisation, post-fertilisation
Life span of organisms and the relationship between reproduction and life span

in_scope: Modes of asexual reproduction with examples
Vegetative propagation in plants: natural and artificial methods
Phases of sexual reproduction: juvenile, reproductive, senescent
Events in sexual reproduction: gametogenesis, gamete transfer, fertilisation, embryogenesis
out_of_scope: Detailed molecular mechanisms of cell differentiation during embryogenesis
Parthenogenesis and apomixis in advanced detail
Reproductive strategies in non-syllabus organisms

concepts.concept_name: Flower structure, microsporogenesis, and male gametophyte development
Megasporogenesis, female gametophyte (embryo sac), and pollination mechanisms
Double fertilisation, endosperm development, embryogenesis, and seed/fruit formation
Outbreeding devices, pollen-pistil interaction, and self-incompatibility

in_scope: Structure of stamen, microsporangium, and pollen grain
Structure of pistil, ovule, and embryo sac (7-celled, 8-nucleate)
Types of pollination: self and cross; agents of pollination
Pollen-pistil interaction and self-incompatibility mechanisms
Double fertilisation and triple fusion
Endosperm development and embryo development (dicot and monocot)
Seed structure, fruit formation, apomixis, polyembryony
out_of_scope: Advanced molecular genetics of self-incompatibility (S-locus genes)
Detailed palynology and pollen morphology beyond basics
Seed technology and industrial seed processing

concepts.concept_name: Male reproductive system: structure, spermatogenesis, and hormonal control
Female reproductive system: structure, oogenesis, and menstrual cycle
Fertilisation, implantation, embryonic development, placenta, and parturition

in_scope: Anatomy of male reproductive system: testes, accessory ducts, glands
Spermatogenesis and structure of sperm
Anatomy of female reproductive system: ovary, oviduct, uterus
Oogenesis and structure of ovum
Menstrual cycle: phases and hormonal regulation
Fertilisation, cleavage, blastocyst, implantation
Placenta: structure and functions; pregnancy hormones
Parturition and lactation
out_of_scope: Assisted reproductive technologies in clinical detail
Detailed embryology beyond implantation stages
Reproductive endocrinology at research level

concepts.concept_name: Reproductive health: awareness, problems, and strategies for healthy society
Contraception: natural, barrier, hormonal, IUDs, surgical methods
Sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and infertility: causes and assisted reproductive technologies

in_scope: Need for reproductive health and prevention strategies
Population explosion and birth control measures
Types of contraceptive methods and their effectiveness
Medical termination of pregnancy (MTP): legal and ethical aspects
STIs: gonorrhoea, syphilis, HIV, hepatitis B, genital herpes
Infertility and ART: IVF, ZIFT, GIFT, ICSI, AI
out_of_scope: Detailed pharmacology of contraceptive drugs
In-depth virology of HIV and other STI pathogens
Legal and policy frameworks across different countries

concepts.concept_name: Mendel's laws of inheritance: dominance, segregation, independent assortment
Extensions of Mendelism: incomplete dominance, codominance, multiple alleles, pleiotropy, polygenic inheritance
Chromosomal theory of inheritance, linkage, recombination, and sex determination
Genetic disorders: Mendelian and chromosomal; pedigree analysis

in_scope: Mendel's experiments and laws with monohybrid and dihybrid crosses
Test cross and back cross
Incomplete dominance, codominance, multiple alleles (ABO blood group)
Pleiotropy, epistasis, polygenic inheritance (skin colour)
Chromosomal theory of inheritance (Sutton and Boveri)
Sex determination: XX-XY, XX-XO, ZZ-ZW systems
Linkage and recombination; sex-linked inheritance (colour blindness, haemophilia)
Pedigree analysis; genetic disorders: Down syndrome, Turner syndrome, Klinefelter syndrome, PKU, sickle cell anaemia
out_of_scope: Advanced statistical genetics and chi-square analysis in detail
Molecular basis of epistatic interactions
Genetic counselling protocols and clinical genetics

concepts.concept_name: DNA: structure, packaging, replication mechanism
Transcription: process in prokaryotes and eukaryotes; RNA processing
Translation: genetic code, tRNA, ribosomes, and protein synthesis
Gene regulation: lac operon model; Human Genome Project and DNA fingerprinting

in_scope: Watson-Crick model of DNA; Hershey-Chase and Griffith experiments
DNA replication: semiconservative (Meselson-Stahl experiment), enzymes involved
Central dogma of molecular biology
Transcription: initiation, elongation, termination; RNA polymerase
Post-transcriptional modifications: splicing, capping, tailing
Genetic code properties; translation process
Lac operon as a model of gene regulation
Human Genome Project: goals, methodology, salient features
DNA fingerprinting: principle and applications
out_of_scope: Advanced chromatin remodelling and epigenetics
Detailed eukaryotic gene regulation (enhancers, silencers, miRNA)
Next-generation sequencing technologies in detail

concepts.concept_name: Origin of life: chemical evolution (Oparin-Haldane hypothesis), Miller-Urey experiment
Evidences of evolution: comparative anatomy, molecular evidence, fossils, biogeography
Theories of evolution: Darwinism, Modern Synthetic Theory, mechanisms of evolution
Hardy-Weinberg principle, speciation, adaptive radiation, and human evolution

in_scope: Theories on origin of life; abiogenesis vs biogenesis
Miller-Urey experiment and chemical evolution
Homologous and analogous organs, vestigial organs
Molecular evidence: sequence similarity in proteins and DNA
Fossil record and geological time scale overview
Darwin's theory of natural selection
Modern Synthetic Theory: gene pool, genetic drift, gene flow, mutation
Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium and factors affecting it
Types of natural selection: stabilising, directional, disruptive
Speciation: allopatric and sympatric
Adaptive radiation with examples (Darwin's finches)
Human evolution: key stages and evidence
out_of_scope: Advanced population genetics and mathematical modelling
Detailed palaeontology and stratigraphy
Molecular clock calculations in depth

concepts.concept_name: Common human diseases: pathogens, symptoms, transmission, and prevention of major infectious diseases
Immunity: innate and adaptive; humoral and cell-mediated immune responses
Cancer, AIDS, and substance abuse: causes, effects, prevention, and treatment

in_scope: Typhoid, pneumonia, common cold, malaria, amoebiasis, ascariasis, filariasis, ringworm
Life cycle of Plasmodium (malaria parasite)
Innate immunity: barriers, phagocytes; adaptive immunity: B and T lymphocytes
Primary and secondary immune responses; vaccination
Antibody structure and types of immunoglobulins
Allergies, autoimmunity, and immunodeficiency
Cancer: types, causes (oncogenes, tumour suppressors), treatment
HIV/AIDS: virus structure, replication, effects on immunity
Drug and alcohol abuse: types, effects, prevention
out_of_scope: Detailed immunology (MHC molecules, antigen presentation pathways)
Cancer genetics and targeted therapy in clinical detail
Pharmacology of specific drugs of abuse

name: Strategies for Enhancement in Food Production

concepts.concept_name: Animal husbandry: dairy management, poultry, fisheries, bee-keeping
Plant breeding: steps, hybridisation, mutation breeding, and biofortification
Single cell protein and tissue culture technology in crop improvement

in_scope: Management of dairy farms, poultry, and fisheries (inland and marine)
Bee-keeping: apiculture basics and honey production
Plant breeding: collection of variability, evaluation, selection, testing, release
Green Revolution and disease-resistant varieties
Biofortification: examples of nutrient-enriched crops
Tissue culture: micropropagation, somatic hybridisation, somaclones
Single cell protein (SCP): Spirulina and other organisms
out_of_scope: Advanced animal genetics and genomic selection
Commercial-scale tissue culture protocols
Agricultural economics and policy

concepts.concept_name: Microbes in household and industrial products: fermentation, antibiotics, chemicals, enzymes
Microbes in sewage treatment and biogas production
Microbes as biocontrol agents and biofertilisers

in_scope: Microbes in household products: curd, bread, toddy, cheese
Industrial products: fermented beverages, antibiotics (penicillin), organic acids, enzymes
Sewage treatment: primary, secondary (activated sludge), and tertiary treatment; BOD
Biogas production: methanogens and biogas plant design
Biocontrol: Bacillus thuringiensis, Trichoderma, baculoviruses
Biofertilisers: Rhizobium, Azospirillum, mycorrhiza, cyanobacteria
out_of_scope: Industrial microbiology and fermentation technology in detail
Detailed biochemical pathways of microbial metabolism
Environmental engineering beyond basic sewage treatment

concepts.concept_name: Genetic engineering: restriction enzymes, cloning vectors, and recombinant DNA technology
Processes of rDNA technology: isolation, cutting, amplification (PCR), ligation, transfer, and selection
Tools of rDNA technology: gel electrophoresis, bioreactors, and downstream processing

in_scope: Principles of genetic engineering: restriction enzymes, DNA ligase
Cloning vectors: plasmids (pBR322), bacteriophages; features of a good vector
Steps of rDNA technology: isolation, fragmentation, ligation, transfer into host
PCR: principle, components, and steps (denaturation, annealing, extension)
Competent host cells and methods of gene transfer (transformation, microinjection, gene gun)
Selectable markers and screening (insertional inactivation, blue-white screening)
Gel electrophoresis and Southern blotting
Bioreactors: simple stirred-tank and sparged stirred-tank
Downstream processing: separation and purification
out_of_scope: CRISPR-Cas9 and advanced gene editing technologies
Detailed vector engineering and synthetic biology
Industrial-scale bioprocessing and GMP regulations

concepts.concept_name: Applications in agriculture: Bt crops, RNA interference, and GM crop examples
Applications in medicine: genetically engineered insulin, gene therapy, molecular diagnostics
Transgenic animals, ethical issues, and biopiracy

in_scope: Bt cotton: mechanism of Cry proteins and pest resistance
RNA interference (RNAi) for pest-resistant plants (Meloidogyne example)
Golden rice and other nutritionally enhanced GM crops
Production of human insulin using E. coli (Humulin)
Gene therapy: ADA deficiency as example
Molecular diagnostics: ELISA, PCR-based diagnosis
Transgenic animals: purpose and examples (Rosie the cow)
Ethical issues in biotechnology; biopiracy and patents (Basmati rice, neem)
out_of_scope: Regulatory frameworks for GMOs across countries in detail
Advanced gene therapy techniques (viral vectors, ex vivo vs in vivo)
Bioinformatics tools and genome databases

concepts.concept_name: Organism and environment: abiotic factors, adaptations, and responses to environment
Population ecology: attributes, growth models, and life history variation
Population interactions: mutualism, competition, predation, parasitism, commensalism, amensalism

in_scope: Abiotic factors: temperature, water, light, soil; responses: regulate, conform, migrate, suspend
Allen's rule, Bergmann's rule, and physiological adaptations
Population attributes: size, density, birth rate, death rate, sex ratio, age distribution
Population growth models: exponential (J-curve) and logistic (S-curve); carrying capacity
Growth equations: dN/dt = rN and dN/dt = rN(K-N)/K
Interspecific interactions with examples for each type
out_of_scope: Advanced mathematical ecology and matrix population models
Detailed behavioural ecology and sociobiology
Landscape ecology and spatial population dynamics

concepts.concept_name: Ecosystem structure: biotic and abiotic components; productivity (GPP, NPP)
Energy flow: food chains, food webs, trophic levels, and ecological pyramids
Nutrient cycling: carbon and phosphorus cycles; ecological succession

in_scope: Components of an ecosystem: producers, consumers, decomposers
Gross primary productivity, net primary productivity, secondary productivity
Grazing and detritus food chains; food webs
10% law of energy transfer (Lindeman's efficiency)
Ecological pyramids: number, biomass, energy; inverted pyramids
Decomposition: steps (fragmentation, leaching, catabolism, humification, mineralisation)
Carbon cycle and phosphorus cycle
Ecological succession: primary and secondary; seral stages, climax community
Ecosystem services
out_of_scope: Advanced biogeochemical modelling
Ecosystem valuation economics in detail
Limnology and oceanography beyond basic concepts

concepts.concept_name: Biodiversity: concept, levels (genetic, species, ecosystem), patterns, and importance
Biodiversity loss: causes (habitat loss, fragmentation, overexploitation, alien species, co-extinctions)
Conservation strategies: in-situ and ex-situ; biodiversity hotspots and protected areas

in_scope: Three levels of biodiversity: genetic, species, ecosystem diversity
Species-area relationship (Alexander von Humboldt); latitudinal gradients
Rivet popper hypothesis (Paul Ehrlich)
Causes of biodiversity loss: habitat destruction, overexploitation, alien species invasions
IUCN Red List categories
In-situ conservation: biosphere reserves, national parks, wildlife sanctuaries, sacred groves
Ex-situ conservation: botanical gardens, seed banks, cryopreservation, zoos
Biodiversity hotspots: criteria and Indian hotspots
International conventions: CBD, Ramsar
out_of_scope: Detailed conservation genetics and population viability analysis
Environmental law and international treaties in exhaustive detail
Remote sensing and GIS applications in conservation

concepts.concept_name: Air and water pollution: causes, effects, control measures; ozone depletion
Solid waste management, agrochemical pollution, radioactive waste, and greenhouse effect
Deforestation, global warming, and case studies in environmental management

in_scope: Air pollution: sources, pollutants, effects, control (electrostatic precipitator, scrubber, catalytic converter)
Water pollution: domestic sewage, industrial effluents; BOD and eutrophication
Solid waste management: reduce, reuse, recycle; biodegradable and non-biodegradable waste
Biomagnification of pesticides (DDT example)
Ozone depletion: CFCs, ozone hole, Montreal Protocol
Greenhouse effect and global warming; enhanced greenhouse effect
Deforestation: causes, consequences, and reforestation efforts
Case studies: Chipko movement, Joint Forest Management
out_of_scope: Advanced atmospheric chemistry and climate modelling
Environmental impact assessment methodologies
Detailed environmental engineering and remediation technologies
